content:
What Vusi's sister 
 said 
 
 Nina Orange 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Early one morning Vusi’s grany caled
 
 him, “Vusi, please take this eg to your
 parents. They want to make a large cake
 for your sister’s weding”. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 On his way to his parents, Vusi met two 
 
 boys picking fruit. One boy grabed the 
 eg from Vusi and shot it at a tre. The 
 eg broke. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “What have you done?” cried Vusi.
 
 “That eg was for a cake. The cake was
 for my sister’s weding. What wil my
 sister say if there is no weding cake?”
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The boys were sory for teasing Vusi. 
 
 “We can’t help with the cake, but here is a 
 walking stick for your sister,” said one. 
 Vusi continued on his journey. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Along the way he met two men building a
 house. “Can we use that strong stick?”
 asked one. 
 
 But the stick was not strong enough for
 building, and it broke. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “What have you done?” cried Vusi. 
 
 “That stick was a gift for my sister. The 
 fruit pickers gave me the stick because 
 they broke the eg for the cake. The cake 
 
 was for my sister’s weding. Now there 
 is no eg, no cake, and no gift. What wil 
 
 my sister say?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The builders were sory for breaking the
 stick. 
 “We can’t help with the cake, but here is
 
 some thatch for your sister,” said one.
 And so Vusi continued on his journey.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Along the way, Vusi met a farmer and a 
 cow. “What delicious thatch, can I have a 
 nible?” asked the cow. 
 
 But the thatch was so tasty that the cow 
 ate it al! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “What have you done?” cried Vusi.
 
 “That thatch was a gift for my sister. The
 builders gave me the thatch because
 they broke the stick from the fruit
 
 pickers. The fruit pickers gave me the
 stick because they broke the eg for my
 sister’s cake. The cake was for my
 
 sister’s weding. Now there is no eg, no
 cake, and no gift. What wil my sister
 
 say?” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The cow was sory she was gredy. The 
 
 farmer agred that the cow could go with 
 Vusi as a gift for his sister. And so Vusi 
 caried on. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But the cow ran back to the farmer at
 super time. 
 
 And Vusi got lost on his journey.
 He arived very late for his sister’s
 weding. The guests were already
 
 eating. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “What shal I do?” cried Vusi. 
 
 “The cow that ran away was a gift, in 
 return for the thatch the builders gave 
 me. The builders gave me the thatch 
 
 because they broke the stick from the 
 fruit pickers. The fruit pickers gave me 
 the stick because they broke the eg for 
 
 the cake. The cake was for the weding. 
 Now there is no eg, no cake, and no 
 
 gift.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Vusi’s sister thought for a while, then she
 said, 
 “Vusi my brother, I don’t realy care about
 
 gifts. I don’t even care about the cake!
 We are al here together, I am hapy. Now
 put on your smart clothes and let’s
 
 celebrate this day!” 
 And so that’s what Vusi did. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13
